intro: Fedia stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit fedia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are clustered in dense inflorescences. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
